Posts.Content: sheridangirl wrote: My pathology report gives my lump the diagnosis of Mesenchymal Fibroblastic proliferation.  Many pathologists looked at it and their consensus is that it is most likely benign but in order to get a complete diagnosis they recommend that I have it removed. I looked up the terms on the internet and am not really sure if the type of lump I have is a cancer or not. My doctor was on vacation and the other doctor would not talk to me. (Too Busy) He just told his assistant that he is referring me to a surgeon. So, I called the hospital and had my path report faxed to the Dr. office and I went and picked it up and after I looked on the internet, I did make an appointment with a breast surgeon for Thursday. I am hoping someone out there can please help me understand what my diagnosis means in laymans terms (do I have cancer) . I am really concerned that something is really wrong. I try not to worry and have done pretty good until I got the path report. Now, I just don't know what to think and am having a hard time concentrating and sleeping. Just worried I guess Lynn Dx 8/10/2009, 1cm, Grade 1, 0/0 nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help Please sheridangirl sheridangirl
